content.rendered:
Observed annually on July 6, International Kissing Day — well, it’s a day of kissing. I don’t think it’s a holiday for the kissing fish, and I’ll probably not be kissing anyone on this day. But anything could happen, I suppose.

The Bible tells us to greet one another with a holy kiss. And if you like, you can put your arms behind your back and pretend you are kissing someone — as a prank.

I know that, during my short marriage to Sandy, we kissed more than in the rest of my entire life. Sandy died of cancer, but she’s alive in Christ, so she’s with Jesus. Some times, I wish I still had someone to spend time with — to kiss.

Maybe you have someone. This would be a great time to share your love story, so, please comment below.
